text: Hello everyone. Does anyone know how to get access to this private beta "multi-step-forms"?
Open a ticket with HS support

Is it this what you are looking for
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Tips-Tricks-Best-Practices/Tracking-WHO-clicked-a-CTA/m-p/724365#:~:text=You%20can%20filter%20for%20contacts,Menu%20%3E%20Contacts%20%3E%20Lists>).

I didn’t see a channel dedicated to reporting in here, so I’m posting this in the General channel.

I want a report that shows all of my contacts as long as the date they were created in HubSpot is _before_ the date found in another field on their record. But I can’t for the life of me figure out how to do that. It’s stupidly simple in basic Salesforce reporting but it doesn’t seem to be an option here. Am I missing it?
Looks like this is available when creating a list. But not a report. So I guess the solution is to build a list and use it as the basis for the report? Cumbersome.

Could you create a workflow which will update a new separate property based on what you need using a customcode action, to then be able to report on that field value?
Not particularly sophisticated... but could be an option
I am new here, I am having issues with booya script. what is the best channel to go to for help?
One thing I might do is a Calculated field where I use a formula to subtract one date from the other date, and then use some math to turn the result (miliseconds) into total days rounded up.
There is a corresponding idea in the community, the PM is monitoring, you can request an invite in the comments

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
